body:
'spack install boost' fails trying to run 'b2 --clean' :  b2 was built with back-end instructions and so fails with 

```
 ./b2 --clean   
[1]    57337 illegal hardware instruction (core dumped)  ./b2 --clean
```
my default environment uses the intel compilers, though 'spack spec' suggests things are built with gcc-6.3.

I do not see a way to ask spack to tell boost to use "toolset=cray".  (was trying to follow advice found in https://cug.org/proceedings/cug2016_proceedings/includes/files/pap127.pdf , which did seem to work for a non-spack build)
title: boost fails to build on Cray (Theta) with "illegal instruction"
